example.name: critical_bug_report
example.description: Reporting a critical bug found during automated testing
example.context: Automated test fails with a database error during user creation
example.code: <bug_report> <title>User creation fails with asyncpg InterfaceError</title> <environment>Windows 11, Python 3.11.3, PostgreSQL 14</environment> <steps_to_reproduce> <step>Run pytest on test_db_crud_async.py</step> <step>Observe failure in test_create_user</step> </steps_to_reproduce> <expected_behavior>User should be created successfully</expected_behavior> <actual_behavior>Test fails with "cannot perform operation: another operation is in progress"</actual_behavior> <evidence> <log>sqlalchemy.exc.InterfaceError: (sqlalchemy.dialects.postgresql.asyncpg.InterfaceError) ...</log> <screenshot>n/a</screenshot> </evidence> <severity>critical</severity> <possible_cause>Concurrent async operations not handled properly</possible_cause> </bug_report>
example.explanation: This example demonstrates a complete, actionable bug report for a critical failure, including all required fields.

example.name: test_case_documentation
example.description: Documenting a manual test case for login functionality
example.context: QA needs to verify login works with valid and invalid credentials
example.code: <test_case> <id>TC-LOGIN-001</id> <description>Verify login with valid credentials</description> <preconditions>User account exists</preconditions> <steps> <step>Navigate to login page</step> <step>Enter valid username and password</step> <step>Click login</step> </steps> <expected_result>User is redirected to dashboard</expected_result> <actual_result>pass</actual_result> <status>pass</status> </test_case>
example.explanation: This example shows how to document a manual test case and record its result.
